alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 4:31AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lawrence, southeastern Meigs, southeastern Gallia, southeastern Lawrence, Mason, Cabell, Putnam, northwestern Lincoln, west central Jackson and northern Wayne Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 428 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Lake Vesuvius to near Huntington to near Fort Gay. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Louisa, Winfield, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Beech Fork State Park, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Fort Gay, Ona, Culloden, East Lynn Lake and Centerville. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 7 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
